snippet: An analysis suggests that ammunition transferred into Syria and Iraq to help stabilize governments has instead passed from the governments to the jihadists.
abstract: Analysis by Conflict Armament Research organization shows that weaponry being used by Islamic State militants appears to have origins in United States, China, former Soviet Union, post-Soviet Russia or Serbia; data suggests that ammunition transferred into Syria and Iraq to help stabilize governments has instead passed from governments to jihadists.

byline.contributor: Karam Shoumali contributed reporting from Gaziantep, Turkey.

lead_paragraph: An analysis suggests that ammunition transferred into Syria and Iraq to help stabilize governments has instead passed from the governments to the jihadists.

headline.main: ISIS’ Ammunition Is Shown to Have Origins in U.S. and China
headline.print_headline: ISIS’ Ammunition Is Shown to Have Origins in U.S. and China

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
